did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Henry N. Hinckley local history ephemera, 1823-1976.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Printed and manuscript ephemera relating to canals, commerce and banking, education, politics and elections, religion, smoking, theater, travel and transportation, and technical equipment, primarily in Ithaca and Tompkins County.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Henry N. Hinckley was born in Trumansburg, NY, son son of Henry L. and Nellie Noble Hinckley. The family moved to ithaca and Henry attended Cornell University, graduating with a degree in architecture in 1911. He worked as an architect and for the Thomas Morse Air Craft Corporation. During World War I, he served in the Signal Corps and with the Air Force in France. After the war, he returned to Ithaca and worked as an investment banker, city building commissioner, owner and manager of residential properties, and collector and authority on antiques. After Henry's death in 1969, his house became the Hinckley Foundation Museum. The museum closed in the 1990s.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Printed and manuscript ephemera relating to canals, commerce and banking, education, politics and elections, religion, smoking, theater, travel and transportation, and technical equipment, primarily in Ithaca and Tompkins County.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Henry N. Hinckley local history ephemera, #6749. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: State Legislature members breakfast and parade (menu card)
List of 4th Ward, Ithaca, N.Y. candidates (2.8"x 2.2" sheet)
U. S. Senate Report of the day, February 5
Woodrow Wilson message calling for war with Imperial German Government in defense of American rights
Itinerary for the visit of the Members of the State Legislature to the parade of the Twenty-Seventh Division, United States Army, New York City
26th Congress, 1st Session, Message from the President of the United States (M. Van Buren) at the Commencement of the First Session {3 uncut leaves}
Laws of New York -- By Authority (Diedrich Willers, Jr.)(1 sheet)
Nuggets and Crystals from the Public Speeches and Official Papres of Benjamin Harrison (booklet)
Protection of Home Labor and Home Productions necessary to the Prosperity of the American Farmer, Henry Carey Baird
Harrison and Morton Campaign Song Book of the Republican Party, H. E. Gordon (booklet)
History of the Discovery of America of the Landing of Our Forefathers at Plymouth and of Their Most Remarkable Engagements With The Indians in New England, Henry Trumbull (booklet)
Proceedings of the Liberal Republican Convention (booklet)
Politics: Speech of Hon. Roscoe Conkling (booklet)
Garfield and Arthur Campaign Song Book (booklet)
An Address to the Friends of the Republican Principle Without Distinction of Party (Town of Ulysses) (leaflet)
Republican National Committee Headquarters receipt for ten dollars
Five Dollars in Democratic Wild Cat Money
Religion: Discourse on The Subject of Truth, as Connected with Regeneration, Rev. William Page (booklet)
7 Presbyterian Church sermons(printed and mss. booklets)
Poems and notes, W. A. van Warrne (sp.?)
W. N. Page to Hermon Camp and Nelson Noble (als)
Travel and Transportation: Pittsfield, Mass. (pocket guide)
New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad Co. ticket
Michigan Central and Great Western Railways cards (2)

Railroad passes: Addison and Pennsylvania; Bath & Hammondsport; Elmira, Cortland & Northern and Canastota; Geneva, Ithaca & Sayre; Jacksonville & Atlantic; Lehigh Valley; Pennsylvania and New York; Seneca Fall & Cayuga Lake; and United States Express Co. (15)
Photo Story of Tri-State's Greatest Flood
Commercial - Banking, Money, etc.: banks: Tompkins County National Bank, Ithaca Savings Bank, National Bank of Ogdensburg (5 items)
Insurance: Equitable Life Assurance Society, Metropolitan Life Insurance Company (2 items)
Education I: printed history of important events in the history of the United States
Fragment of writing re Jefferson Davis (mss.)

Education II - Printed items re: Trumansburg Academy, Cooperstown Seminary and Female Collegiate Institute, Cortland Academy, Dryden Seminary, Oswego Commercial College and Telegraphic Institute (5 items)
"Our school is coming to a close" words for song (mss.)
Letter from Mr. Jefferson in possession of Queen Victoria (printed)
Miscellaneous over size items: Economy of Horse Power (broadside)
Loan of the City of Philadelphia (certificate)
